intro: Alhagi persarum, commonly known as the Persian grass or goat's rue, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia and Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring slender, branched stems and small, pale green to yellowish leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which are followed by pods containing several seeds. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep roots that allow it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Alhagi persarum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various health purposes.
